Place the treadmill indoors; do not use or reserve the treadmill outdoor.

Wear comfortable clothing and preferably sports or aerobic shoes.

Stand on two side rails when the treadmill starts; clip the safety key to your clothes to control any emergency.
Clip the safety key cord with your clothes.
Insert power plug and turn on power; place safety key on console and clip to clothes; after screen displays, treadmill enters manual program PO; press START to begin workout.
The treadmill will start after a delay of 5 seconds and run at a speed of 1.0Km/h.
0.6 mph
Press the 'stop' button to stop the motor from running; you can also pull out the safety key to stop the treadmill immediately.
Console does not detect safety lock signal; check whether the safety key is in correct position; reinstall the safety key sock; replace the console
Pull off the safety key and then press the 'PROGRAM' and 'MODE' keys at the same time; display shows 0.6 for kilometers to miles, 1.0 for miles to kilometers
3 user-programmable profiles (U01-U03) are available
10 segments
30 minutes
In the running state, QUICK SPEED keys directly set the speed to the specified value of the key.
In the running state, QUICK INCLINE keys directly set the incline to the specified value of the key.
Distance and time are shown in the 'DISTANCE''TIME' window; calories in the 'CALORIES' window; incline in the 'INCLINE' window; pulse in the 'PULSE' window; speed in the 'SPEED' window.
The speed or incline adjustment is only valid in the current segment; when switching to a different segment, the setting resets and three beeps sound.
The motor stops automatically, accompanied by a long stop prompt sound.
Press the 'PAUSE' button to pause; press 'START' to resume without losing data.
ERP mode is the default power-saving mode; the console enters sleep state after about 4.5 minutes of no operation.
In standby mode, press and hold the MODE button for about 3 seconds to display '2222' to cancel (turn off) ERP; long press again for about 3 seconds to display '1111' to return (turn on) ERP mode.

Manual; Safety key; Silicon oil; Wrench; Cross Wrench 14x17×75

Take treadmill out of box; turn out foot folding rod from underside of running deck with foot; lift stand post while stepping on foot folding rod; hold handle bar with one hand and pull up monitor tray with other hand; pull up monitor to suitable position; treadmill is now unfolded.

Push down the monitor to the same level as the monitor tray; press the button and lay down the monitor tray; step firmly on the foot folding rod with your foot and the stand post will lay down slowly; pull off the power cord, pull out the two stretch foot pads, then lift the treadmill to stand on the ground.
Do not strike after standing up.
Cut off the power before moving the treadmill.

Turn on the power supply and power switch; after the display is normal, press the 'Program' button to select an automatic running mode; press the 'Start' button to start the treadmill, which will run automatically according to the selected mode.
Yes; use the speed quick key to quickly enter the running speed you need while running.
After the motor stops, incline the treadmill to a certain height and adjust the rear feet pad; adjustable in two gears.
Hold both hands on the metal heartbeat sensor
No; heart rate readings are for sports reference only, not medical use
Stop exercising immediately; lay down on the ground until you feel better; consult a doctor if needed.
No; keep children away from the treadmill to avoid any accident or injury
No; only one person at a time is allowed to use the treadmill.
Outdoor use is not allowed
Pull out the plug when meet with power failure suddenly, may cause accident and injury when power resumption.
Hold the plug, not the wire, when pulling out the plug; pull out the plug gently from the socket; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands.
No, do not open motor and roller cover unless professionals.
Do not use the treadmill after meals or when tired; may cause damage to your health.
The treadmill is intended for home use; it cannot be used in school or gymnasium.

People with backache, leg/waist/neck injuries, numbness, chronic diseases (intervertebral disc protrusion, spinal slip, cervical vertebra protrusion), deformational arthritis, rheumatism, gout, osteoporosis, circulatory system issues (heart disease, vascular disorders, hypertension), respiratory disturbance, artificial heart rhythm problems, malignant tumors, thrombosis, diabetes with perceptual disturbance, skin injury, high fever above 38°C, bent backbone, pregnancy or menstrual period, discomfort, poor condition, using for rehabilitation, abnormal physical features; consult a doctor before use.

Press the PROGRAM key to select BMI; press MODE to select item number; use + and - to set parameters (sex, age, height, weight); after setting, hold hands on heart rate sensors for 4 seconds to enter body fat test state.
F1: Sex, 1=male, 2=female, range 1-2; F2: Age, range 1-99 years; F3: Height, range 100-220CM (39-87inch); F4: Weight, range 20-150KG (44-330lb)
Underweight: BMI < 18; Ideal: BMI 18-24; Overweight: BMI 25-28; Obese: BMI > 29 (Asian standard)
Stop the treadmill by pulling out the safety key or pressing the 'stop' button; turn off the power and pull out the plug.
12 operation keys
PROGRAM key
MODE key
At stop, START/PAUSE turns on the treadmill; during running, it pauses the treadmill.
Stops the motor from running
2 seconds
10 segments per P1–P36 workout
Press 'QUICK INCLINE' or the incline adjustment key during motor running to adjust the treadmill inclination.

Connect power plug to grounded socket; ensure treadmill is stable; check if function is normal before running; stand on side rails when starting; clip safety key to clothes; prepare with left leg before trial run; only one person allowed; overload exercise prohibited.

Keep power cord away from hot objects; do not damage or twist the power cord; do not put heavy things on it; do not operate with wet hands; do not pull out or insert the plug with wet hands; hold the plug not the wire when pulling out; keep the power plug away from needle, waste or water.
Stop using immediately; pull out the plug; make a trouble call, may cause electric shock and injury.
Anyrun; Kinomap; Zwift

Turn on device Bluetooth in Settings; log in to Anyrun APP; go to Settings > Device Management; find and click the device's Bluetooth name; system connects automatically; console displays Bluetooth connection symbol after success.

Login Zwift APP on mobile; select running speed in running on the matching device page; click Matching; select SW-XXXXXX-XXXX (the number on the console) on the search page and press OK; select YOUR SPEED on the 'What's YOUR SPEED' page and press OK; select route and training mode, then click 'Run'; console synchronizes data with Zwift during movement; Bluetooth cannot be connected to the console under engineering mode.
Bluetooth cannot be connected to the console under the page of engineering mode.
Turn on Bluetooth on your smartphone; select 'RUN MUSIC' in Bluetooth devices; connect; once connected, music can play via Bluetooth.
Place 8mm wrench on left belt tension bolt and turn clockwise 1/4 turn; repeat for right bolt; turn both bolts same number of turns; repeat until slipping is eliminated; do not overtighten.
Turn both belt tension bolts counter-clockwise the same number of turns.

Start treadmill without anyone on it and set speed to 6km/h; observe belt position; if belt is left, turn left adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and right bolt counter-clockwise 1/4 turn; if belt is right, turn right adjustment bolt clockwise 1/4 turn and left bolt counter-clockwise 1/4 turn; repeat until centered; increase speed to 13km/h to verify; repeat if necessary.
13kph
Check lubrication regularly; usually not necessary in first year or first 500 hours; after every 3 months of operation check for traces of silicon spray; only use oil free silicon spray.

Lift the belt at one side; insert the spray valve of the lubricant container; spray oil free silicon spray from front to back for about 4 seconds per side; repeat on the other side; wait 1 minute before starting the machine.
Wipe the console and other surfaces with a clean soft and damp cloth to remove sweat residues.
Store your treadmill in a clean and dry environment; ensure the master power switch is off and it is unplugged from the electrical wall outlet.
Check and reconnect the speed sensor; replace the speed sensor if defective; clean dust or grease on the speed sensor; replace the controller if needed.
Reconnect the communication cable and check if the terminal is connected well or replace the communication cable; replace the console; replace the controller.

E-02 indicates defective motor cable and motor; resolve by replacing the motor; or poor connection between motor cable and controller or defective controller; resolve by checking and connecting cables well or replacing the controller.
E-05 indicates: A. Controller is damaged; B. damaged motor; C. mechanical failure

Press any key to wake up the system from ERP sleep.
Stop the machine and cut the power immediately; support the handle bar to push up and leave running belt if needed; ask local distributor for service; do not dismantle components personally.
No; do not jump up or down from the treadmill when running, may fall down and get injury.
Reserve the silicon bottle to some place that children cannot reach
Do not operate with wet hands; may cause electric shock or injury.
Disassemble, repair, change by customer themselves are forbid absolutely; may cause mechanical breakdown and injury.
Turn off the power before folding the unit.
Connect the power plug to a socket with a grounded circuit; the socket must have a special circuit not shared with other electrical equipment; ensure the treadmill is stable on the ground before use.
Keep less indoor dust and a certain extent of humidity to avoid interference of console and controller.
Check if the machine's power switch is turned off; check if the power plug has been unplugged from the power connector; check if the treadmill has been folded.
Wait 1 minute to let the silicon spray spread before starting the machine.
